turns.content: Hello, am I speaking with Sunita Jain? This is Priya calling from QuickLend Financial Services regarding your personal loan account.

Yes, this is Sunita Jain. I've been expecting your call, to be honest. My husband lost his job due to the pandemic and things have been really tough for us, I'm not sure how I'm going to pay the loan right now.

I'm so sorry to hear that, Sunita. I can only imagine how challenging this must be for you and your family. According to our records, your outstanding balance is around ₹250,000 with an overdue amount of ₹50,000. Can you tell me a little bit about your current financial situation and if you have any plans for getting back on track with your payments?

The outstanding balance is ₹200,000, not ₹250,000, I'm sure of it. And yes, we're struggling to make ends meet, my husband's job loss has been a huge setback. I was wondering if it's possible to get a temporary waiver or some extra time to pay, just until my husband finds a new job and we can get back on our feet.

I apologize for the error, Sunita, you are correct that the outstanding balance is ₹200,000. I understand that this is a difficult time for you, and I'm willing to work with you to find a solution. We can discuss possible options, such as a temporary payment deferment or restructuring your EMIs to make them more manageable. Would a reduced monthly payment for the next 3-6 months be something that could help you get back on track?

That sounds like a big help, thank you for understanding. A reduced EMI for the next few months would be a huge relief, I think we could manage that. Can you tell me what kind of reduction we're talking about, and would there be any extra charges or interest added to the loan?

I can offer you a temporary reduction of about 50% of your current EMI, Sunita, which would be around ₹5,000 per month for the next 6 months. As for extra charges, there won't be any penalty fees, but the interest will continue to accrue on the outstanding balance. However, we can discuss the possibility of waiving some of the interest accrued during the deferment period, depending on your payment history and overall loan performance. Would you like me to send you a formal proposal outlining the revised payment plan?

₹5,000 per month is definitely more manageable for us right now, I think we can make that work. And please, yes, consider waiving some of the interest, it would be a big help. Yes, please send me the proposal, I'd like to see all the details in writing before we finalize anything.

I'll go ahead and send you a formal proposal outlining the revised payment plan, including the reduced EMI and the interest waiver details, Sunita. You should receive it via email within the next 24 hours. In the meantime, I just need a confirmation from you that you intend to accept the proposed plan, and we can consider this as a tentative agreement. Shall I follow up with you in a week's time to confirm receipt of the proposal and discuss any further questions you may have?

That sounds good, yes, I intend to accept the proposed plan, so you can consider this as a tentative agreement. And yes, please follow up with me in a week's time, I'll make sure to review the proposal carefully and we can discuss any questions I may have then. [AGREES TO PLAN]
